title: Need a champ that can do a ton of damage but is fairly easy to play
body: Tbh I just started playing and I'm very bad (bronze 2) but I can do ok with skill shots and mechanics.

Is victor a good champ I've been having fun with him
If you've been having fun with him, play him. Games are for having fun
{{champion:22}}

Garen is a good choice for simple mechanics and good damage. 

There is also Yi, Annie, and Caitlyn.
Yi is dead, i wouldnt recommend him even for bots.

> [{quoted}](name=Ralanr,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=7M9KOpME,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-06-26T19:21:27.631+0000)
>
> Garen is a good choice for simple mechanics and good damage. 
> 
> There is also Yi, Annie, and Caitlyn.

Master Yi? You take him into a higher elo than bronze and tell me how easy it is to carry when the enemy team actually knows what they're doing. Easy to play sure, Hard to Master. IMO. :3

Ok. What does that have to do with bronze?

The OP asked for a champion that can do a ton of damage and is fairly easy to _play_. Master Yi fits that.

> [{quoted}](name=Ralanr,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=7M9KOpME,comment-id=000000010000,timestamp=2016-06-26T19:38:59.154+0000)
>
> Ok. What does that have to do with bronze?
> 
> The OP asked for a champion that can do a ton of damage and is fairly easy to _play_. Master Yi fits that.

Master Yi fits that only if you have a wide knowledge of the game you have to know when to Q to dodge cc or you will die. Someone new to the game will not have the knowledge of every champ capable of using cc and when to dodge them. on top of the fact that you also need to know when to dodge thing like viegar's ult sure its not cc but you die when it hits you, etc... and thats the easy part of learning Master Yi. then you have to utilize when to you his w to reduce damage and when to use it as an aa reset. and the most important thing is when to go in. let's face it you cant just run into the entire enemy team and expect good things youll get destroyed.
I'm saying he's not hard to pick up. I'm not saying his skill ceiling is low.

> [{quoted}](name=Ralanr,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=7M9KOpME,comment-id=00000001000000000000,timestamp=2016-06-26T19:48:01.098+0000)
>
> I'm saying he's not hard to pick up. I'm not saying his skill ceiling is low.

To be fair you could have just said Tryndamere. He is also hard to master but at least he's easier to play and is punished less for mistakes. I'd recommend him to a new player before I'd recomend Master Yi. :3 Recommending Yi is about like recommending kat sure they both can penta but only in the right hands.

You're right, I could have recommended Tryndamyre. I guess I didn't because I don't want to see more of them. 

I didn't recommend Kat because of her ability to ward hop.

xD Fear the Plague of Tryndamere's.
And yes Kat's skill cap is just like Master Yi's.

I wouldn't agree on that. Course I'm probably biased, but I feel AA based champions are less difficult than caster based champions because AA based champions mainly just have to keep close enough to their target for them to AA, while caster based champions need to plan their combos well enough to maximize their damage.

> [{quoted}](name=Ralanr,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=7M9KOpME,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-06-26T19:21:27.631+0000)
>
> Garen is a good choice for simple mechanics and good damage. 
> 
> There is also Yi, Annie, and Caitlyn.

The only adc id recommend is ezreal tbh.  Any other adc still has to have good positioning which is the hadest

I only suggest Cait because of her incredible range. 

Anyone of these champions can be played very well when you have understanding of positioning and other forms of game knowledge. But they're pretty easy to pick up for beginners.

> [{quoted}](name=Ralanr,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=7M9KOpME,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2016-06-26T19:25:33.558+0000)
>
> I only suggest Cait because of her incredible range. 
> 
> Anyone of these champions can be played very well when you have understanding of positioning and other forms of game knowledge. But they're pretty easy to pick up for beginners.

Yeah you're right but i just dont think any adc is easy because everyone on the enemy team is aiming for you. Even the support.

Tbh ive been climbing to diamond with my secondary role (Top lane) Because i find it difficult now with my primary adc, you need such a good team to be relevent as an adc and i main caitlyn lol 450 games in the counting.

I never said adc was easy (I am really bad at it) I was just recommending an easy to pick up champion in that lane that does high damage. 

Caitlyn is relatively simple. Her role isn't.

Jayce. Stay in ranged mode, poke with autos and an occasional q, but when ur ready to go in go hammer, q w e(backwards aka away from their tower) r into ranged again, auto w and when their gona "get away" e q. Easy game easy life. Lol

{{champion:1}} {{champion:1}} {{champion:1}} {{champion:1}} {{champion:1}} {{champion:1}} {{champion:1}} {{champion:1}} {{champion:1}} {{champion:1}} {{champion:1}} {{champion:1}} {{champion:1}} 
and {{champion:1}}

Well think of it this way. casters can stay back and poke, AA based have to get closer, the closer you are the easier it is for the enemy to land a skill shot and the harder it is to dodge one. casters and aa based champs each have their downsides. Imo it's much more punishing if you make a mistake with an aa based champ than with a caster. if you mess up with a caster at least you have some sort of gap between you and the enemy to try and get away or wait for cd's. with an aa based champ if you mess up it's to late to run...
Ok I will add you later

its not just about the champ, its about game knowledge too and making right choices.

any champ can be easy and do a ton of damage, you just need to know how to make smart decisions with them. if you want me to teach you on stuff like this just add me, I got some good champs that might help you with not just difficulty and power but great decision making.
Also I play adc or mid
Thx
{{champion:24}} is pretty good in that regards. But you have to know your powerspikes and to play a bit passive earlygame.
But is victor a strong champ? Also does draven have good damage?

> [{quoted}](name=Jmanwg,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=7M9KOpME,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2016-06-26T19:35:46.397+0000)
>
> But is victor a strong champ? Also does draven have good damage?

Viktor is one of the best mid laners right now IMO.

One of the best, Not the best. Every pick is situational.

Draven has the best damage out of all the adcs per auto. But hes not ''easy'' to play

Viktor can be very strong. 

Draven is incredibly punishing if you're not great at positioning. I would not recommend him for a beginner.

You didn't specify a role, but let me see. 

Toplane:
**Garen **is in a good pick right now, but you gotta know how to play him: if low in health hide in a bush, never use your speed buff until you know they cast all of their debuffs on you. 

**Trundle** is a simple champion too, if they pick a tank you can pick them into them, cause Trundle was created to counter tanks. Just remember to not fully engage before level 6. His ult steals Health, Armor and Magic Resistence, making  you the tankiest champion when ulting someone else.

Jungle: 
**Amumu** is pretty easy champion, you just need to time your Q and not miss your R.

**Warwick** is another easy champion too, devourer and then tanky.

Mid:
**Annie **is pretty simple, you get mana refunded and CDR if you kill minions with your Q, so you never run out of it. Her stuns are easy and she is hard to counter play.

**Ziggs**, even though he is all about skillshots, he has short CD's and you can save yoursel from ganks and the fact that you can destroy turrets under 25% heatlh with your E is ridiculous.  

ADC: 
I feel like **Jhin **is pretty easy, not sure about anyone else, and he has an insane damage with good CC and speed buffs, he counters mostly all ADC's right now.

**Cait **is another one that is easy and really strong right now.

Support:
**Sona** (though she is geting nerfed soon). She has no skillshots, but her ult. 

My favorite is **Zac **support, his passive is silly in low elo as your opponents usually go for you, and then your passive procs while your ADC gets a double kill as you come back. You have hard CC and your W is good against tanks. Max E then W, then Q and you are set. Only issue is Morgana, she makes you a bit useless so never pick him into her.
Always {{champion:119}} come, join us on dirty draven main side.
